column9: I have PCOS and didn't have my period for about 8 months. I was used to it because when I was 18 I missed my periods by months. My doctor first said it was normal then I went to the Gyno. Anyways, at the end of April I went to the Gyno and she prescribed this for me to jump start my period then I had to take my birth control as soon as my period started. I got my period the day after I finished my 10th pill. I had my period for 7 days. It's been two weeks and I just started getting my period again! Is this happening to anyone else? I'm calling the doctor tomorrow but I just wanted to see if this has happened to anyone else. Overall the medicine did what it was supposed to do. The only side effects I had were really bad headaches and dizzyness.

column1: Other
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this three times so far in my life. My doc gave them to me before starting Ortho Novum. She wanted to see if I had the ability to bleed to begin with. The first time I used it, it took a week after I'd stopped for me to bleed (my first ever period). The second time was because I hadn't been faithful to taking the Ortho due to the fact I'd throw up sometimes. That time, I bled the week after I stopped. I just finished my third time taking it, and bled a few days after I finished. The cramps are something fierce, but I assume they'll get better, since when taking the Ortho Novum the cramps were killer at first, then not bothersome as years passed. I don't remember how I was before, but I felt 'off' while taking it, and it bummed me out. A day or two after my week ended, I was fine. Luckily for me, I now have a choice between taking a low-dose birth control pill, or sticking to this. I'm leaning on sticking to this, since it's one less pill to worry about, and I'll only need 10 days worth.

column2: lizlaur, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I recently discovered that I have Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome so my doctor prescribed me this medicine to get my period started again. This is my 7th day on the pill and I have never been so depressed.  I can't stop crying, I've gained weight, and I'm overlly tired, spending all of my free time in my bed.  I can't wait to be done with this medication.  If you're on it, know that the mood swings are caused by the medication.  If you're already a depressed person, it may make your depression worse.

column1: Other
column2: Julie, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I took this medication expecting no side effect because it was prescribed to sluff of the lining of my uterus like a chemical D&C.  At first I didn't notice much change.  But, by the 4th day I had trouble breathing extreme, backache mild, and the worst part was the mood swings and altered mood.  I totally verbally attacked my husband thinking he didn't love me and demanding a divorce.  He tried to tell me he loved me and I just freaked out and could not control my mood.  I am not taking this again.  This was not normal as I love my husband dearly, but on this medication I felt as though I hated him and I had less emotion for my children.  The  doctor knew I suffer from depression and take 40mg of Celexa and I smoke.  What was relatively controlled depression turned into paranoia, screaming, and such horrible mood swings I am surprised my husband did not walk out.  I had this reaction within 4 days.  I stopped taking the medication and I just can't believe how out of control I was. Thank God my husband had me check the side effects as he knew this behavior was not "me."  Evidently, my side effects from this medication are considered rare and I am evidently sensitive to this medication, I did experience horrible depression, anxiety, suicidal thoughts and etc.

column1: Other
column2: MesquiteBrieTX, 19-24 Female  (Patient)
column9: I started taking this  medicine after bleeding for 8 months straight. I stopped bleeding on the 3rd day of taking it and I continued on the 10 day dose. I then didnt bleed for two weeks. I then had sex and started right back up again. For two weeks straight. Went back to the doctor and she change my birth control and game me Progesterone once again. I  am on my 2nd day and I was FLOODING earlier but now I am noticing that I  am slowing down. I am 24 and after them doing tests and sonograms they cant find anything wrong with me. And bleeding like this is strange for one because all my life I have been abnormal, and by abnormal I am talking about 1 or 2 periods a year. So It works for me but like some of the other people I read it gives me crazy mood swings and my breast get real tender. The only think next for me if this doesnt work is a D&C so cross your fingers for me.

column1: Abnormal Uterine Bleeding caused by Imbalance of Hormones
column2: cali, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication after experiencing abnormal bleeding accompanied by significant discharge that was clear and no unusual order.  My last normal period was two months ago.  Approx. 2 weeks after the normal cycle ended I had some spotting over two days.  I did not begin my regular period when I expected and about 3 weeks after the spotting began light to medium bleeding which lasted for almost three weeks before I visited the Dr.  (The amount was generally light to medium although one day I experienced significant flow and several large clots.)  Prescribed 14 days therapy of 10mg once per day.  After one day the bleeding decreased noticably and I just "felt" better, almost "lighter."  After three days the bleeding has essentailly stopped, but I do have what appears to be the remenents of some "old" blood.  No noticable side effects.  So far working as expected and I am quite pleased.

column1: Abnormal Uterine Bleeding caused by Imbalance of Hormones
column2: 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I first took this drug in 2005 for 10 days to jumpstart my period and it worked fine - no side effects.  Earlier this year, I then experienced a heavy and long period (3 weeks), so I was prescribed medroxyprogesterone again for 10 days.  The bleeding stopped and I went on to a regular period, but I had broken out in a rash on my 5th day of taking the medicine but since that didn't happen the first time, my dr. and I thought it must have been caused by something else.  Recently, I experienced the same heavy period issue and took the drug, but again, broke out in a rash on my 4th day.  While it resolved my period issues, it made me more miserable to have a rash than a period.

column1: Disease of Ovaries with Cysts
column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for 2 to less than 5 years (Patient)
column9: I have polycystic ovarian sydnrome.  I found out at a few years ago at the age of around 18 or 19.  I have been on the medicine ever since I was diagonosed.  It had definitely delivered and I get my period reguarly when I take the med's.  I do suffer some slight side effects with nausea and headaches but for the most part if it's keeping me healthy I am willing to suffer through a few headaches.  I do get migraines and have some med's for that when they get really bad but for the most part this medicine makes me feel like a normal woman again.  At the age of 22 I am glad that I found out so early what the problem was and that my outcome was not so serious.  Definitely would recommend women who have issues with their period to get checked for the disease because it is more common then you think.
